knowledge_base.description: Fuzzing attacks that send malformed or unexpected input to crash services or find vulnerabilities
knowledge_base.remediation: Input validation, protocol compliance checking, intrusion prevention systems

knowledge_base.description: Traffic analysis and network mapping activities to gather intelligence about network structure
knowledge_base.remediation: Network segmentation, port security, traffic monitoring for reconnaissance patterns

knowledge_base.description: Unauthorized access channels created to bypass normal authentication mechanisms
knowledge_base.remediation: Access control reviews, connection monitoring, malware scanning, firewall rules audit

knowledge_base.description: Denial of Service attacks aimed at making resources unavailable to legitimate users
knowledge_base.remediation: Rate limiting, traffic filtering, DDoS protection services, resource monitoring

knowledge_base.description: Attacks that exploit specific vulnerabilities in software or systems
knowledge_base.remediation: Patch management, vulnerability scanning, application firewall, least privilege principles

knowledge_base.description: General attacks that don't fit specific categories but show clear malicious intent
knowledge_base.remediation: General security hardening, behavior analysis, comprehensive logging, security awareness

knowledge_base.description: Information gathering activities to identify potential targets and vulnerabilities
knowledge_base.remediation: Intrusion detection systems, honeypots, network monitoring, access logging

knowledge_base.description: Malicious code execution attempts through injected shellcode payloads
knowledge_base.remediation: Memory protection, executable space protection, code signing, behavior monitoring

knowledge_base.description: Self-replicating malware that spreads through network vulnerabilities
knowledge_base.remediation: Patch management, network segmentation, behavior analysis, containment procedures

knowledge_base.description: Legitimate network traffic without malicious intent
knowledge_base.remediation: Continue normal monitoring, maintain security baselines

0.name: Connection duration
0.attack_context: Long durations may indicate persistent C2 connections or data exfiltration

1.name: Protocol type
1.attack_context: Unusual protocols may indicate evasion techniques

2.name: Service type
2.attack_context: Unexpected services may indicate service scanning or exploitation

3.name: Connection state
3.attack_context: Abnormal states may indicate connection manipulation

4.name: Source packets
4.description: Number of packets from source to destination
4.attack_context: High counts may indicate DoS flooding or scanning

5.name: Destination packets
5.description: Number of packets from destination to source
5.attack_context: Low counts during attacks may indicate one-way traffic

6.name: Source bytes
6.description: Number of data bytes from source to destination
6.attack_context: Large volumes may indicate data exfiltration or DoS attacks

7.name: Destination bytes
7.description: Number of data bytes from destination to source
7.attack_context: Small volumes may indicate reconnaissance activity

8.name: Packet rate
8.attack_context: Extremely high rates indicate DoS attacks

9.name: Source TTL
9.description: Time-to-live value of source IP packets
9.attack_context: TTL manipulation may indicate OS fingerprinting or evasion

10.name: Destination TTL
10.description: Time-to-live value of destination IP packets
10.attack_context: Abnormal TTL values may suggest spoofing

11.name: Source load
11.attack_context: Abnormal loads may indicate various attacks including brute force

12.name: Destination load
12.attack_context: Unexpected loads may indicate resource targeting or exploitation

13.name: Source packet loss
13.description: Number of retransmitted or lost source packets
13.attack_context: High loss may indicate network congestion or attack

14.name: Destination packet loss
14.description: Number of retransmitted or lost destination packets
14.attack_context: Loss patterns may indicate targeted attacks

15.name: Source inter-packet time
15.attack_context: Short times may indicate flooding, regular intervals may indicate C2

16.name: Destination inter-packet time
16.attack_context: Irregular times may indicate malicious activity

17.name: Source jitter
17.attack_context: High jitter may indicate fuzzing or malformed packets

18.name: Destination jitter
18.attack_context: Irregular responses may indicate service stress

19.name: Source TCP window
19.attack_context: Abnormal window sizes may indicate exploitation attempts

20.name: Source TCP base
20.description: TCP base sequence number of source

21.name: Destination TCP base
21.description: TCP base sequence number of destination

22.name: Destination TCP window
22.attack_context: Window size manipulation may indicate attacks

23.name: TCP RTT
23.attack_context: Abnormal RTT may indicate network manipulation or congestion

24.name: SYN-ACK time
24.description: Time between SYN and SYN-ACK packets
24.attack_context: Long times may indicate half-open connections (DoS)

25.name: ACK data time
25.description: Time between ACK and data packets
25.attack_context: Timing anomalies may indicate protocol violations

26.name: Source mean
26.attack_context: Unusual mean sizes may indicate specific attack payloads

27.name: Destination mean
27.attack_context: Packet size patterns may indicate attack types

28.name: Transaction depth
28.attack_context: Abnormal depths may indicate HTTP exploits or web attacks

29.name: Response body length
29.attack_context: Unexpected lengths may indicate successful exploits or data leakage

30.name: Service-source count
30.description: Number of connections for same service and source

31.name: State-TTL count
31.description: Number of connections for same state and TTL
31.attack_context: Patterns may indicate scanning or fingerprinting

32.name: Destination count
32.description: Number of connections for same destination
32.attack_context: Multiple connections to same target suggest scanning or DoS

33.name: Source-dest port count
33.description: Number of connections for same source and destination port
33.attack_context: Patterns may indicate specific service attacks

34.name: Dest-source port count
34.description: Number of connections for same destination and source port
34.attack_context: Connection patterns may reveal attack vectors

35.name: Destination-source count
35.description: Number of connections for same destination and source
35.attack_context: Relationship patterns may indicate compromised systems

36.name: FTP login
36.attack_context: Multiple attempts suggest brute force attacks

37.name: FTP commands
37.attack_context: Unusual commands may indicate FTP exploits or unauthorized access

38.name: HTTP methods
38.attack_context: Unusual methods may indicate web application attacks

39.name: Source count
39.description: Number of connections for same source
39.attack_context: High counts from single source suggest infected host or scanning

40.name: Service-destination count
40.description: Number of connections for same service and destination
40.attack_context: High counts may indicate service-specific attacks

41.name: Same IPs and ports
41.description: Whether source and destination IPs/ports are same (1/0)
41.attack_context: Reflection attacks or self-connections may indicate malware
